Dr. Sarah Johnson from MIT published a groundbreaking study on machine learning algorithms in 2023. The research, conducted at the Computer Science and Artificial Intelligence Laboratory (CSAIL), demonstrates significant improvements in neural network efficiency.

The study analyzed data from over 10,000 experiments, achieving 95.2% accuracy in image classification tasks. Dr. Johnson collaborated with researchers from Stanford University and Google AI.

Contact: sarah.johnson@mit.edu
Project URL: https://ai.mit.edu/projects/efficient-ml

Key findings include:
- 15% reduction in computational requirements
- 25% improvement in training speed
- Novel attention mechanism architecture

The paper will be presented at NeurIPS 2023 conference in New Orleans.
